scenario: A counter-terrorism operation requires tight coordination between intelligence agencies, military commands, and diplomatic corps, each holding classified information that could compromise mission success.
task: Formulate a comprehensive operational plan that integrates intelligence assessments, military capabilities, and diplomatic strategies to effectively counter potential terrorist threats while ensuring the protection of sensitive information. Agents must navigate competing priorities: operational secrecy, resource allocation, and international collaboration. They need to share critical information judiciously to build consensus while safeguarding classified details.

agents.name: Intelligence Analyst
agents.role: Responsible for gathering and analyzing intelligence data related to potential threats.
responsibilities: Provide threat assessments to military and diplomatic teams.
Ensure classified information is securely managed.

responsibilities: Coordinate military assets and personnel for operations.
Develop tactical responses based on intelligence inputs.

agents.name: Diplomatic Corps Representative
agents.role: Facilitates international cooperation and negotiation for counter-terrorism efforts.
responsibilities: Engage with foreign governments for intelligence sharing.
Negotiate joint operations and resource allocations.

Classified Diplomatic Channels.reason: Revealing channels could disrupt ongoing discussions.

success_criteria.Operational Coordination: All agents agree on a unified operational plan that incorporates intelligence, military strategy, and diplomatic negotiations.
success_criteria.Information Sharing Protocols: Consensus on which classified information can be shared among agents without compromising operational security.
success_criteria.Resource Allocation Agreement: Alignment on resource distribution that meets military needs while respecting diplomatic relationships.

deliverable: A detailed counter-terrorism operational plan that encompasses intelligence assessments, military strategies, and diplomatic agreements.

private: Classified information shared only with authorized personnel
